sentences.zh: 太史公讀秦記，至犬戎敗幽王，周東徙洛邑，秦襄公始封為諸侯，作西畤用事上帝，僭端見矣。

translations.literal: When the Grand Historian read the Qin records, reaching the point where the Quanrong defeated King You and Zhou moved east to Luoyi, Duke Xiang of Qin was first enfeoffed as a feudal lord, built the Western Altar to serve the Supreme Deity—the first signs of presumption appeared.
translations.idiomatic: When the Grand Historian read the Qin records, reaching the point where the Quanrong defeated King You and Zhou moved east to Luoyi, Duke Xiang of Qin was first enfeoffed as a feudal lord, built the Western Altar to serve the Supreme Deity—the first signs of presumption appeared. (translated).

sentences.zh: 《禮》曰：「天子祭天地，諸侯祭其域內名山大川。」

translations.literal: The Rites say: 'The Son of Heaven sacrifices to Heaven and Earth, feudal lords sacrifice to the famous mountains and great rivers within their domains.'
translations.idiomatic: The Rites say: 'The Son of Heaven sacrifices to Heaven and Earth, feudal lords sacrifice to the famous mountains and great rivers within their domains.' (translated).

sentences.zh: 今秦雜戎翟之俗，先暴戾，後仁義，位在藩臣而臚於郊祀，君子懼焉。

translations.literal: Now Qin mixed the customs of the Rong and Di, putting violence and tyranny first, benevolence and righteousness after. Though positioned as a vassal minister, they performed suburban sacrifices—the gentlemen were alarmed.
translations.idiomatic: Now Qin mixed the customs of the Rong and Di, putting violence and tyranny first, benevolence and righteousness after. Though positioned as a vassal minister, they performed suburban sacrifices—the gentlemen were alarmed. (translated).

sentences.zh: 及文公踰隴，攘夷狄，尊陳寶，營岐雍之閒，而穆公修政，東竟至河，則與齊桓、晉文中國侯伯侔矣。

translations.literal: When Duke Wen crossed the Long mountains, drove back the Yi and Di barbarians, honored Chen Bao, and camped between Qi and Yong, Duke Mu repaired his government, his eastern border reached the Yellow River, and thus he equaled the central states' feudal lords like Duke Huan of Qi and Duke Wen of Jin.
translations.idiomatic: When Duke Wen crossed the Long mountains, drove back the Yi and Di barbarians, honored Chen Bao, and camped between Qi and Yong, Duke Mu repaired his government, his eastern border reached the Yellow River, and thus he equaled the central states' feudal lords like Duke Huan of Qi and Duke Wen of Jin. (translated).

sentences.zh: 是後陪臣執政，大夫世祿，六卿擅晉權，征伐會盟，威重於諸侯。

translations.literal: After this, attendants took charge of government, grand officers held hereditary stipends, the six ministers monopolized Jin's power, conducting campaigns and alliances, their authority greater than the feudal lords.
translations.idiomatic: After this, attendants took charge of government, grand officers held hereditary stipends, the six ministers monopolized Jin's power, conducting campaigns and alliances, their authority greater than the feudal lords. (translated).

sentences.zh: 及田常殺簡公而相齊國，諸侯晏然弗討，海內爭於戰功矣。

translations.literal: When Tian Chang killed Duke Jian and became chancellor of Qi, the feudal lords were complacently undisturbed, all under Heaven contended for military achievements. (translated).
translations.idiomatic: When Tian Chang assassinated Duke Jian and became chancellor of Qi, the feudal lords remained complacently undisturbed, as all under Heaven competed for military glory.

sentences.zh: 三國終之卒分晉，田和亦滅齊而有之，六國之盛自此始。

translations.literal: The three states finally divided Jin, Tian He also extinguished Qi and possessed it—the flourishing of the six states began from this time.
translations.idiomatic: The three states finally divided Jin, Tian He also extinguished Qi and possessed it—the flourishing of the six states began from this time. (translated).

sentences.zh: 務在彊兵并敵，謀詐用而從衡短長之說起。

translations.literal: Their efforts were devoted to strengthening troops and uniting against enemies, and the sayings of scheming, deception, and the vertical and horizontal alliances of long and short arose from this. (translated).
translations.idiomatic: Their efforts focused on strengthening armies and allying against enemies, giving rise to doctrines of scheming and deception, and the strategies of vertical and horizontal alliances.

sentences.zh: 矯稱蜂出，誓盟不信，雖置質剖符猶不能約束也。

translations.literal: False pretenses swarmed like bees, oaths and covenants were not trusted, even placing hostages and splitting tallies could not bind them. (translated).
translations.idiomatic: False pretenses swarmed like bees emerging from a hive, oaths and covenants lacked credibility, and even exchanging hostages and splitting tally sticks could not bind them.

sentences.zh: 秦始小國僻遠，諸夏賓之，比於戎翟，至獻公之後常雄諸侯。

translations.literal: Qin began as a small, remote country, the various Xia treated it as a guest, compared it to the Rong and Di, until after Duke Xian it constantly dominated the feudal lords. (translated).
translations.idiomatic: Qin began as a small, remote country that the various Xia states treated as a guest, comparing it to the barbarian Rong and Di tribes, until after Duke Xian's time when it constantly dominated the other feudal lords.

sentences.zh: 論秦之德義不如魯衛之暴戾者，量秦之兵不如三晉之彊也，然卒并天下，非必險固便形勢利也，蓋若天所助焉。

translations.literal: Discussing Qin's virtue and righteousness as inferior to the violent tyranny of Lu and Wei, measuring Qin's troops as not as strong as the three Jins, yet in the end it united all under Heaven—not necessarily because of dangerous fortifications, convenient terrain, or advantageous positions, but rather as if Heaven assisted it.
translations.idiomatic: Discussing Qin's virtue and righteousness as inferior to the violent tyranny of Lu and Wei, measuring Qin's troops as not as strong as the three Jins, yet in the end it united all under Heaven—not necessarily because of dangerous fortifications, convenient terrain, or advantageous positions, but rather as if Heaven assisted it. (translated).

translations.literal: When the Grand Historian read the Qin records, reaching the point where the Quanrong defeated King You and Zhou moved east to Luoyi, Duke Xiang of Qin was first enfeoffed as a feudal lord, built the Western Altar to serve the Supreme Deity—the first signs of presumption appeared. The Rites say: 'The Son of Heaven sacrifices to Heaven and Earth, feudal lords sacrifice to the famous mountains and great rivers within their domains.' Now Qin mixed the customs of the Rong and Di, putting violence and tyranny first, benevolence and righteousness after. Though positioned as a vassal minister, they performed suburban sacrifices—the gentlemen were alarmed. When Duke Wen crossed the Long mountains, drove back the Yi and Di barbarians, honored Chen Bao, and camped between Qi and Yong, Duke Mu repaired his government, his eastern border reached the Yellow River, and thus he equaled the central states' feudal lords like Duke Huan of Qi and Duke Wen of Jin. After this, attendants took charge of government, grand officers held hereditary stipends, the six ministers monopolized Jin's power, conducting campaigns and alliances, their authority greater than the feudal lords. When Tian Chang killed Duke Jian and became chancellor of Qi, the feudal lords were complacently undisturbed, all under Heaven contended for military achievements. The three states finally divided Jin, Tian He also extinguished Qi and possessed it—the flourishing of the six states began from this time. Their efforts were devoted to strengthening troops and uniting against enemies, and the sayings of scheming, deception, and the vertical and horizontal alliances of long and short arose from this. False pretenses swarmed like bees, oaths and covenants were not trusted, even placing hostages and splitting tallies could not bind them. Qin began as a small, remote country, the various Xia treated it as a guest, compared it to the Rong and Di, until after Duke Xian it constantly dominated the feudal lords. Discussing Qin's virtue and righteousness as inferior to the violent tyranny of Lu and Wei, measuring Qin's troops as not as strong as the three Jins, yet in the end it united all under Heaven—not necessarily because of dangerous fortifications, convenient terrain, or advantageous positions, but rather as if Heaven assisted it.

sentences.zh: 或曰「東方物所始生，西方物之成孰」。

translations.literal: Some say 'Eastern things begin life there, western things mature there.'
translations.idiomatic: Some say 'Eastern things begin life there, western things mature there.' (translated).

sentences.zh: 夫作事者必於東南，收功實者常於西北。

translations.literal: Those who initiate affairs must do so in the southeast, those who gather actual merit are constantly in the northwest. (translated).
translations.idiomatic: Those who initiate undertakings must do so in the southeast, while those who gather real achievements are always found in the northwest.

sentences.zh: 故禹興於西羌，湯起於亳，周之王也以豐鎬伐殷，秦之帝用雍州興，漢之興自蜀漢。

translations.literal: Thus Yu rose from the Western Qiang, Tang arose from Bo, Zhou's kings used Feng and Hao to attack Yin, Qin's emperors used Yong province to rise, Han's rise came from Shu and Han.
translations.idiomatic: Thus Yu rose from the Western Qiang, Tang arose from Bo, Zhou's kings used Feng and Hao to attack Yin, Qin's emperors used Yong province to rise, Han's rise came from Shu and Han. (translated).

translations.literal: Some say 'Eastern things begin life there, western things mature there.' Those who initiate affairs must do so in the southeast, those who gather actual merit are constantly in the northwest. Thus Yu rose from the Western Qiang, Tang arose from Bo, Zhou's kings used Feng and Hao to attack Yin, Qin's emperors used Yong province to rise, Han's rise came from Shu and Han.

sentences.zh: 秦既得意，燒天下詩書，諸侯史記尤甚，為其有所刺譏也。

translations.literal: Qin, having achieved its ambitions, burned the poems and documents of all under Heaven, the feudal lords' historical records especially so, because they contained criticisms.
translations.idiomatic: Qin, having achieved its ambitions, burned the poems and documents of all under Heaven, the feudal lords' historical records especially so, because they contained criticisms. (translated).

sentences.zh: 詩書所以復見者，多藏人家，而史記獨藏周室，以故滅。

translations.literal: The reason the poems and documents reappeared was that many were hidden in people's homes, but the historical records were stored only in the Zhou court, so they were destroyed.
translations.idiomatic: The reason the poems and documents reappeared was that many were hidden in people's homes, but the historical records were stored only in the Zhou court, so they were destroyed. (translated).

sentences.zh: 惜哉，惜哉！

translations.literal: Alas, alas!
translations.idiomatic: Alas, alas! (translated).

sentences.zh: 獨有秦記，又不載日月，其文略不具。

translations.literal: Only the Qin records remained, but they did not record dates and months, their text was brief and incomplete. (translated).
translations.idiomatic: Only the Qin records survived, but they failed to record dates and months, their content brief and incomplete.

sentences.zh: 然戰國之權變亦有可頗采者，何必上古。

translations.literal: Yet the stratagems and changes of the Warring States also have much worth adopting—why must it be ancient times?
translations.idiomatic: Yet the stratagems and changes of the Warring States also have much worth adopting—why must it be ancient times? (translated).

sentences.zh: 秦取天下多暴，然世異變，成功大。

translations.literal: Qin took the world with much violence, yet eras change, great success was achieved. (translated).
translations.idiomatic: Qin seized the empire through much violence, yet times change, and great success was achieved.

sentences.zh: 傳曰「法後王」，何也？

translations.literal: The tradition says 'Follow later kings,' why is that?
translations.idiomatic: The tradition says 'Follow later kings,' why is that? (translated).

sentences.zh: 以其近己而俗變相類，議卑而易行也。

translations.literal: Because they are close to us and their customs and changes are similar, their doctrines are humble and easy to implement. (translated).
translations.idiomatic: Because they are close to us and their customs and transformations are similar, their teachings are modest and easy to implement.

sentences.zh: 學者牽於所聞，見秦在帝位日淺，不察其終始，因舉而笑之，不敢道，此與以耳食無異。

translations.literal: Scholars are constrained by what they have heard, seeing Qin in the imperial position for few days, not examining its beginning and end, so they laugh at it, not daring to discuss it—this is no different from eating with the ears.
translations.idiomatic: Scholars are constrained by what they have heard, seeing Qin in the imperial position for few days, not examining its beginning and end, so they laugh at it, not daring to discuss it—this is no different from eating with the ears. (translated).

sentences.zh: 悲夫！

translations.literal: How lamentable!
translations.idiomatic: How lamentable! (translated).

translations.literal: Qin, having achieved its ambitions, burned the poems and documents of all under Heaven, the feudal lords' historical records especially so, because they contained criticisms. The reason the poems and documents reappeared was that many were hidden in people's homes, but the historical records were stored only in the Zhou court, so they were destroyed. Alas, alas! Only the Qin records remained, but they did not record dates and months, their text was brief and incomplete. Yet the stratagems and changes of the Warring States also have much worth adopting—why must it be ancient times? Qin took the world with much violence, yet eras change, great success was achieved. The tradition says 'Follow later kings,' why is that? Because they are close to us and their customs and changes are similar, their doctrines are humble and easy to implement. Scholars are constrained by what they have heard, seeing Qin in the imperial position for few days, not examining its beginning and end, so they laugh at it, not daring to discuss it—this is no different from eating with the ears. How lamentable!

sentences.zh: 余於是因秦記，踵春秋之後，起周元王，表六國時事，訖二世，凡二百七十年，著諸所聞興壞之端。

translations.literal: I therefore followed the Qin records, continued after the Spring and Autumn Annals, beginning from King Yuan of Zhou, chronicled the affairs of the six states, ending with the Second Emperor, altogether 270 years, recording the causes of rise and fall that I have heard.
translations.idiomatic: I therefore followed the Qin records, continued after the Spring and Autumn Annals, beginning from King Yuan of Zhou, chronicled the affairs of the six states, ending with the Second Emperor, altogether 270 years, recording the causes of rise and fall that I have heard. (translated).

sentences.zh: 後有君子，以覽觀焉。

translations.literal: May future gentlemen use this to observe and reflect. (translated).
translations.idiomatic: May future gentlemen use this for observation and reflection.

translations.literal: I therefore followed the Qin records, continued after the Spring and Autumn Annals, beginning from King Yuan of Zhou, chronicled the affairs of the six states, ending with the Second Emperor, altogether 270 years, recording the causes of rise and fall that I have heard. May future gentlemen use this to observe and reflect.

sentences.zh: 公元前

translations.idiomatic: BCE (translated).

translations.idiomatic: Wei (translated).

translations.idiomatic: Han (translated).

translations.idiomatic: Zhao (translated).

translations.idiomatic: Yan (translated).

translations.literal: Qi
translations.idiomatic: Qi (translated).

cells.literal: Yuan Wang first year.
Li Gong Gong first year.
Xian Zi. Wei Chu Gong Zhe later first year.
cells.idiomatic: Xian Zi. Wei Chu Gong Zhe later first year. (translated).

cells.literal: Xuan Zi
Jian Zi. Forty-two.
Hui Wang Zhang thirteen years. Wu attacked us.
cells.idiomatic: Hui Wang Zhang thirteen years. Wu attacked us. (translated).

cells.literal: Xian Gong seventeen years.
Ping Gong Ao five years.
Two. Shu people came with tribute.
cells.idiomatic: Two. Shu people came with tribute. (translated).

cells.literal: Jin Ding Gong died.
Fourteen. Yue besieged Wu, Wu resented.
cells.idiomatic: Fourteen. Yue besieged Wu, Wu resented. (translated).

cells.literal: Jin Chu Gong Cuo first year.
cells.idiomatic: Jin Chu Gong Cuo first year. (translated).

cells.literal: Seven. Yue people first came.
Sixteen. Yue extinguished Wu.
Five. Chu people came with tribute.
cells.idiomatic: Five. Chu people came with tribute. (translated).

cells.literal: Seventeen. Cai Jing Hou died.
Nine. Jin Zhi Bo Yao came to attack us.
cells.idiomatic: Nine. Jin Zhi Bo Yao came to attack us. (translated).

cells.literal: Six. Yi Qu came with tribute. Mian Zhu begged aid.
cells.idiomatic: Six. Yi Qu came with tribute. Mian Zhu begged aid. (translated).

cells.literal: Eighteen. Cai Sheng Hou first year.
cells.idiomatic: Eighteen. Cai Sheng Hou first year. (translated).

cells.literal: Seven. Comet appeared.

cells.content: 衛出公飲，大夫不解襪，公怒，即攻公，公奔宋。
cells.literal: Wei Chu Gong drank, grandees did not remove socks, duke angered, then attacked duke, duke fled to Song.
cells.idiomatic: Wei Chu Gong drank, grandees did not remove socks, duke angered, then attacked duke, duke fled to Song. (translated).

cells.literal: Nineteen. Wang Zi Ying fled to Qin.
cells.idiomatic: Nineteen. Wang Zi Ying fled to Qin. (translated).

cells.literal: Ding Wang first year..

cells.content: 十。庶長將兵拔魏城。彗星見。
cells.literal: Ten. Shu Zhang led troops took Wei city. Comet appeared.
cells.idiomatic: Ten. Shu Zhang led troops took Wei city. Comet appeared. (translated).

cells.literal: Twenty-two. Lu Ai Gong died.

cells.content: 二十三。魯悼公元年。三桓勝，魯如小侯。
cells.literal: Twenty-three. Lu Dao Gong first year. Three Huan victorious, Lu became small marquess.
cells.idiomatic: Twenty-three. Lu Dao Gong first year. Three Huan victorious, Lu became small marquess. (translated).

cells.content: 知伯伐鄭，駟桓子如齊求救。
cells.literal: Zhi Bo attacked Zheng, Si Huan Zi went to Qi to seek aid.
cells.idiomatic: Zhi Bo attacked Zheng, Si Huan Zi went to Qi to seek aid. (translated).

cells.content: 五十四。知伯謂簡子，欲廢太子襄子，襄子怨知伯。
cells.literal: Fifty-four. Zhi Bo told Jian Zi, wished to depose crown prince Xiang Zi, Xiang Zi resented Zhi Bo.
cells.idiomatic: Fifty-four. Zhi Bo told Jian Zi, wished to depose crown prince Xiang Zi, Xiang Zi resented Zhi Bo. (translated).

cells.literal: Yan Xiao Gong first year

cells.content: 十七。救鄭，晉師去。中行文子謂田常：「乃今知所以亡。」
cells.literal: Seventeen. Rescued Zheng, Jin army withdrew. Zhong Xing Wen Zi told Tian Chang: 'Only now know the reason for perishing.'
cells.idiomatic: Seventeen. Rescued Zheng, Jin army withdrew. Zhong Xing Wen Zi told Tian Chang: 'Only now know the reason for perishing.' (translated).

cells.literal: Fourteen. Jin people, Chu people came with tribute.
cells.idiomatic: Fourteen. Jin people, Chu people came with tribute. (translated).

cells.literal: Zheng Sheng Gong died.
Zheng Ai Gong first year.

cells.content: 十六。塹阿旁。伐大荔。補龐戲城。
cells.literal: Sixteen. Dug moat at A beside. Attacked Da Li. Repaired Pang Xi city.
cells.idiomatic: Sixteen. Dug moat at A beside. Attacked Da Li. Repaired Pang Xi city. (translated).

cells.literal: Twenty. Duke led army fought with Mian Zhu.
cells.idiomatic: Twenty. Duke led army fought with Mian Zhu. (translated).

cells.content: 襄子。元年未除服，登夏屋，誘代王，以金斗殺代王。封伯魯子周為代成君。
cells.literal: Xiang Zi. First year mourning not ended, climbed Xia house, lured Dai king, killed Dai king with gold ladle. Enfeoffed Bo Lu Zi Zhou as Dai Cheng Jun.
cells.idiomatic: Xiang Zi. First year mourning not ended, climbed Xia house, lured Dai king, killed Dai king with gold ladle. Enfeoffed Bo Lu Zi Zhou as Dai Cheng Jun. (translated).

cells.literal: Thirty-two. Cai Sheng Hou died.
Jin Ai Gong Ji first year.
cells.idiomatic: Jin Ai Gong Ji first year. (translated).

cells.literal: Thirty-three. Cai Yuan Hou first year.
cells.idiomatic: Thirty-three. Cai Yuan Hou first year. (translated).

cells.literal: Wei Dao Gong Qian first year.
cells.idiomatic: Wei Dao Gong Qian first year. (translated).

cells.literal: Qi Xuan Gong Jiu Za first year.
cells.idiomatic: Qi Xuan Gong Jiu Za first year. (translated).

cells.literal: Four. Divided Fan, Zhong Xing land with Zhi Bo.
cells.idiomatic: Four. Divided Fan, Zhong Xing land with Zhi Bo. (translated).

cells.literal: Wei Huan Zi defeated Zhi Bo at Jin Yang.
cells.idiomatic: Wei Huan Zi defeated Zhi Bo at Jin Yang. (translated).

cells.literal: Han Kang Zi defeated Zhi Bo at Jin Yang.
cells.idiomatic: Han Kang Zi defeated Zhi Bo at Jin Yang. (translated).

cells.content: 五。襄子敗智伯晉陽，與魏、韓三分其地。
cells.literal: Five. Xiang Zi defeated Zhi Bo at Jin Yang, with Wei, Han divided his land in three.
cells.idiomatic: Five. Xiang Zi defeated Zhi Bo at Jin Yang, with Wei, Han divided his land in three. (translated).

cells.content: 二十五。晉大夫智開率其邑來奔。
cells.literal: Twenty-five. Jin grandee Zhi Kai led his yi came fleeing.
cells.idiomatic: Twenty-five. Jin grandee Zhi Kai led his yi came fleeing. (translated).

cells.literal: Twenty-six. Zuo Shu Zhang built Nan Zheng city.
cells.idiomatic: Twenty-six. Zuo Shu Zhang built Nan Zheng city. (translated).

cells.idiomatic: Qin Xiao Gong first year. Comet appeared in west. (translated).

cells.content: 十。取趙皮牢。衛成侯元年。
cells.literal: Ten. Took Zhao Pi Lao. Wei Cheng Hou first year.
cells.idiomatic: Ten. Took Zhao Pi Lao. Wei Cheng Hou first year. (translated).

cells.literal: Yan Wen Gong first year
Nine. Presented sacrificial meat to Qin.
cells.idiomatic: Nine. Presented sacrificial meat to Qin. (translated).

cells.literal: Two. Son of Heaven presented sacrificial meat.
cells.idiomatic: Two. Son of Heaven presented sacrificial meat. (translated).

cells.literal: Twelve. Star fell by day, had sound.
cells.idiomatic: Twelve. Star fell by day, had sound. (translated).

cells.content: 韓昭侯元年。秦敗我西山。
cells.literal: Han Zhao Hou first year. Qin defeated us at Xi Shan.
cells.idiomatic: Han Zhao Hou first year. Qin defeated us at Xi Shan. (translated).

cells.content: 二十一。鄒忌以鼓琴見威王。
cells.literal: Twenty-one. Zou Ji seen Wei Wang by playing zither.
cells.idiomatic: Twenty-one. Zou Ji seen Wei Wang by playing zither. (translated).

cells.literal: Fourteen. Met with Zhao at Hang.
cells.idiomatic: Fourteen. Met with Zhao at Hang. (translated).

cells.content: 二。宋取我黃池。魏取我朱。
cells.literal: Two. Song took our Huang Chi. Wei took our Zhu.
cells.idiomatic: Two. Song took our Huang Chi. Wei took our Zhu. (translated).

cells.literal: Eighteen. Zhao Meng went to Qi.
cells.idiomatic: Eighteen. Zhao Meng went to Qi. (translated).

cells.literal: Thirteen. Jun Yin Hei welcomed woman from Qin.
cells.idiomatic: Thirteen. Jun Yin Hei welcomed woman from Qin. (translated).

cells.literal: Twenty-two. Enfeoffed Zou Ji as Cheng Hou.
cells.idiomatic: Twenty-two. Enfeoffed Zou Ji as Cheng Hou. (translated).

cells.literal: Fifteen. Lu, Wei, Song, Zheng lords came.
cells.idiomatic: Fifteen. Lu, Wei, Song, Zheng lords came. (translated).

cells.content: 十九。與燕會阿。與齊、宋會平陸。
cells.literal: Nineteen. Met with Yan at E. Met with Qi, Song at Ping Lu.
cells.idiomatic: Nineteen. Met with Yan at E. Met with Qi, Song at Ping Lu. (translated).

cells.literal: Twenty-three. Met with Zhao at Ping Lu.
cells.idiomatic: Twenty-three. Met with Zhao at Ping Lu. (translated).

cells.literal: Seven. Met with Wei Wang at Du Ping.
cells.idiomatic: Seven. Met with Wei Wang at Du Ping. (translated).

cells.content: 十六。與秦孝公會杜平。侵宋黃池，宋復取之。
cells.literal: Sixteen. Met with Qin Xiao Gong at Du Ping. Invaded Song Huang Chi, Song again took it.
cells.idiomatic: Sixteen. Met with Qin Xiao Gong at Du Ping. Invaded Song Huang Chi, Song again took it. (translated).

cells.literal: Twenty-four. Met with Wei at Tian at Jiao.
cells.idiomatic: Twenty-four. Met with Wei at Tian at Jiao. (translated).

cells.content: 八。與魏戰元里，斬首七千，取少梁。
cells.literal: Eight. Fought with Wei at Yuan Li, beheaded seven thousand, took Shao Liang.
cells.idiomatic: Eight. Fought with Wei at Yuan Li, beheaded seven thousand, took Shao Liang. (translated).

cells.content: 十七。與秦戰元里，秦取我少梁。
cells.literal: Seventeen. Fought with Qin at Yuan Li, Qin took our Shao Liang.
cells.idiomatic: Seventeen. Fought with Qin at Yuan Li, Qin took our Shao Liang. (translated).

cells.literal: Twenty-one. Wei besieged our Han Dan.
cells.idiomatic: Twenty-one. Wei besieged our Han Dan. (translated).

cells.content: 十八。邯鄲降。齊敗我桂陵。
cells.literal: Eighteen. Han Dan surrendered. Qi defeated us at Gui Ling.
cells.idiomatic: Eighteen. Han Dan surrendered. Qi defeated us at Gui Ling. (translated).

cells.literal: Six. Attacked Dong Zhou, took Ling Guan, Lin Qiu.
cells.idiomatic: Six. Attacked Dong Zhou, took Ling Guan, Lin Qiu. (translated).

cells.literal: Twenty-two. Wei pulled Han Dan.
Twenty-six. Defeated Wei at Gui Ling.
cells.idiomatic: Twenty-six. Defeated Wei at Gui Ling. (translated).

cells.content: 十。衛公孫鞅為大良造，伐安邑，降之。
cells.literal: Ten. Wei Gong Sun Yang became great good maker, attacked An Yi, surrendered it.
cells.idiomatic: Ten. Wei Gong Sun Yang became great good maker, attacked An Yi, surrendered it. (translated).

cells.content: 十九。諸侯圍我襄陵。築長城，塞固陽。
cells.literal: Nineteen. Feudal lords besieged our Xiang Ling. Built long wall, blocked Gu Yang.
cells.idiomatic: Nineteen. Feudal lords besieged our Xiang Ling. Built long wall, blocked Gu Yang. (translated).

cells.literal: Eighteen. Lu Kang Gong first year
cells.idiomatic: Eighteen. Lu Kang Gong first year (translated).

cells.content: 十一。城商塞。衛鞅圍固陽，降之。
cells.literal: Eleven. Built Shang Sai city. Wei Yang besieged Gu Yang, surrendered it.
cells.idiomatic: Eleven. Built Shang Sai city. Wei Yang besieged Gu Yang, surrendered it. (translated).

cells.literal: Twenty. Returned Zhao Han Dan.
Eight. Shen Bu Hai became chancellor.
cells.idiomatic: Eight. Shen Bu Hai became chancellor. (translated).

cells.content: 二十四。魏歸邯鄲，與魏盟漳水上。
cells.literal: Twenty-seven. Defeated Wei at Gui Ling.
cells.idiomatic: Twenty-seven. Defeated Wei at Gui Ling. (translated).

cells.content: 十二。初聚小邑為三十一縣，令。為田開阡陌。
cells.literal: Twelve. First gathered small yi to make thirty-one xian, ordered. For fields opened qian mo.
cells.idiomatic: Twelve. First gathered small yi to make thirty-one xian, ordered. For fields opened qian mo. (translated).

cells.literal: Thirteen. Wei Yang moved capital to Xian Yang. Prince Ang attacked Wei.
cells.idiomatic: Thirteen. Wei Yang moved capital to Xian Yang. Prince Ang attacked Wei. (translated).

cells.literal: Twenty-four. Defeated Wei at Ma Ling.
cells.idiomatic: Twenty-four. Defeated Wei at Ma Ling. (translated).

cells.literal: Fourteen. Wei Yang became chancellor.
Twenty-five. Wei defeated us at Ma Ling.
cells.idiomatic: Twenty-five. Wei defeated us at Ma Ling. (translated).

cells.literal: Fifteen. Wei Yang exiled.
Twenty-six. Wei defeated us at Gu River.
cells.idiomatic: Twenty-six. Wei defeated us at Gu River. (translated).

cells.content: 三。公子范襲邯鄲，不勝，死。
cells.literal: Sixteen. Attacked Wei, took He Yang.
cells.idiomatic: Sixteen. Attacked Wei, took He Yang. (translated).

cells.literal: Seventeen. Wei attacked us, took He Yang.
cells.idiomatic: Seventeen. Wei attacked us, took He Yang. (translated).

cells.literal: Eighteen. Wei attacked us, took Cheng Gao.
cells.idiomatic: Eighteen. Wei attacked us, took Cheng Gao. (translated).

cells.content: 二十七。丹封名會。丹，魏大臣。
cells.literal: Twenty-eight. Defeated Wei at Chang Ping.
cells.idiomatic: Twenty-eight. Defeated Wei at Chang Ping. (translated).

cells.literal: Nineteen. Wei took our Cheng Gao.
cells.idiomatic: Nineteen. Wei took our Cheng Gao. (translated).

cells.literal: Twenty-nine. Qin defeated Wei at Chang Ping.
cells.idiomatic: Twenty-nine. Qin defeated Wei at Chang Ping. (translated).

cells.content: 十九。城武城。從東方牡丘來歸。天子致伯。
cells.literal: Twenty. Qin defeated Wei at Hu Yang.
cells.idiomatic: Twenty. Qin defeated Wei at Hu Yang. (translated).

cells.literal: Thirty. Qin took our Wu Cheng.
cells.idiomatic: Thirty. Qin took our Wu Cheng. (translated).

cells.content: 二十。諸侯畢賀。會諸侯于澤。朝天子。
cells.literal: Twenty. Feudal lords all congratulated. Met feudal lords at Ze. Court the Son of Heaven.
cells.idiomatic: Twenty. Feudal lords all congratulated. Met feudal lords at Ze. Court the Son of Heaven. (translated).

cells.literal: Thirty-one. Qin defeated us at Hu Yang.
cells.idiomatic: Thirty-one. Qin defeated us at Hu Yang. (translated).

cells.literal: Thirty-two. Qin took our Tai Yuan.
cells.idiomatic: Thirty-two. Qin took our Tai Yuan. (translated).

cells.literal: Twenty-two. Qin took our Tai Yuan.
cells.idiomatic: Twenty-two. Qin took our Tai Yuan. (translated).

cells.content: 三十。齊虜我太子申，殺將軍龐涓。
cells.literal: Thirty-three. Qin took our Yang Qu.
cells.idiomatic: Thirty-three. Qin took our Yang Qu. (translated).

cells.content: 二。敗魏馬陵。田忌、田嬰、田馊將，孫子為師。
cells.literal: Two. Defeated Wei at Ma Ling. Tian Ji, Tian Ying, Tian Chou led, Sun Zi became teacher.
cells.idiomatic: Two. Defeated Wei at Ma Ling. Tian Ji, Tian Ying, Tian Chou led, Sun Zi became teacher. (translated).

cells.literal: Twenty-three. Qin took our Shang Dang.
cells.idiomatic: Twenty-three. Qin took our Shang Dang. (translated).

cells.content: 三十一。秦商君伐我，虜我公子卬。
cells.literal: Thirty-five. Qin took our Han Zhong.
cells.idiomatic: Thirty-five. Qin took our Han Zhong. (translated).

cells.literal: Thirty-six. Qin took our Sui Zhong.
cells.idiomatic: Thirty-six. Qin took our Sui Zhong. (translated).

cells.literal: Twenty-four. Qin took our Sui Zhong.
cells.idiomatic: Twenty-four. Qin took our Sui Zhong. (translated).

cells.literal: Thirty-seven. Qin took our Yan, Ying.
cells.idiomatic: Thirty-seven. Qin took our Yan, Ying. (translated).

cells.literal: Thirty-eight. Qin took our Ju You.
cells.idiomatic: Thirty-eight. Qin took our Ju You. (translated).

cells.content: 二十四。（秦）大荔圍合陽。孝公薨。商君反，死彤地。
cells.literal: Twenty-four. (Qin) Da Li besieged He Yang. Xiao Gong died. Shang Jun rebelled, died at Tong Di.
cells.idiomatic: Twenty-four. (Qin) Da Li besieged He Yang. Xiao Gong died. Shang Jun rebelled, died at Tong Di. (translated).

cells.content: 三十三。衛鞅亡歸我，我恐，弗內。
cells.literal: Thirty-three. Wei Yang fled returned to us, we feared, did not let in.
cells.idiomatic: Thirty-three. Wei Yang fled returned to us, we feared, did not let in. (translated).

cells.content: 秦惠文王元年。楚、韓、趙、蜀人來。
cells.literal: Qin Hui Wen Wang first year. Chu, Han, Zhao, Shu people came.
cells.idiomatic: Qin Hui Wen Wang first year. Chu, Han, Zhao, Shu people came. (translated).

cells.literal: Twenty-two. Shen Bu Hai died.
Thirty-three. Congratulated Qin.

cells.content: 二。天子賀。行錢。宋太丘社亡。
cells.literal: Two. Son of Heaven congratulated. Circulated coin. Song Tai Qiu She disappeared.
cells.idiomatic: Two. Son of Heaven congratulated. Circulated coin. Song Tai Qiu She disappeared. (translated).

cells.content: 三十五。孟子來，王問利國，對曰：「君不可言利。」
cells.literal: Thirty-five. Meng Zi came, king asked about benefiting state, replied: 'Lord cannot speak of profit.'
cells.idiomatic: Thirty-five. Meng Zi came, king asked about benefiting state, replied: 'Lord cannot speak of profit.' (translated).

cells.literal: Seven. Met with Wei at Ping A south.
cells.idiomatic: Seven. Met with Wei at Ping A south. (translated).

cells.literal: Three. King crowned. Pulled Han Yi Yang.
cells.idiomatic: Three. King crowned. Pulled Han Yi Yang. (translated).

cells.literal: Twenty-four. Qin pulled our Yi Yang
cells.idiomatic: Twenty-four. Qin pulled our Yi Yang (translated).

cells.literal: Eight. Met with Wei at Zhen.
cells.idiomatic: Eight. Met with Wei at Zhen. (translated).

cells.content: 四。天子致文武胙。魏夫人來。
cells.literal: Four. Son of Heaven presented civil military sacrificial meat. Wei lady came.
cells.idiomatic: Four. Son of Heaven presented civil military sacrificial meat. Wei lady came. (translated).

cells.content: 魏襄王元年。與諸侯會徐州，以相王。
cells.literal: Wei Xiang Wang first year. Met with feudal lords at Xu Zhou, to mutually king.
cells.idiomatic: Wei Xiang Wang first year. Met with feudal lords at Xu Zhou, to mutually king. (translated).

cells.content: 二十五。旱。作高門，屈宜臼曰「昭侯不出此門。」
cells.literal: Twenty-five. Drought. Made high gate, Qu Yu Jiu said 'Zhao Hou will not go out this gate.'
cells.idiomatic: Twenty-five. Drought. Made high gate, Qu Yu Jiu said 'Zhao Hou will not go out this gate.' (translated).

cells.literal: Twenty-eight. Su Qin persuaded Yan.

cells.content: 九。與魏會徐州，諸侯相王。
cells.literal: Nine. Met with Wei at Xu Zhou, feudal lords mutually king.
cells.idiomatic: Nine. Met with Wei at Xu Zhou, feudal lords mutually king. (translated).

cells.content: 五。陰晉人犀首為大良造。
cells.literal: Five. Yin Jin man Xi Shou became great good maker.
cells.idiomatic: Five. Yin Jin man Xi Shou became great good maker. (translated).

cells.literal: Two. Qin defeated us at Diao Yin.
cells.idiomatic: Two. Qin defeated us at Diao Yin. (translated).

cells.content: 二十六。高門成，昭侯卒，不出此門。
cells.literal: Twenty-six. High gate completed, Zhao Hou died, did not go out this gate.
cells.idiomatic: Twenty-six. High gate completed, Zhao Hou died, did not go out this gate. (translated).

cells.literal: Seven. Besieged Qi at Xu Zhou.
cells.idiomatic: Seven. Besieged Qi at Xu Zhou. (translated).

cells.literal: Ten. Chu besieged our Xu Zhou.
cells.idiomatic: Ten. Chu besieged our Xu Zhou. (translated).

cells.content: 六。魏以陰晉為和，命曰寧秦。
cells.literal: Six. Wei used Yin Jin for peace, named Ning Qin.
cells.idiomatic: Six. Wei used Yin Jin for peace, named Ning Qin. (translated).

cells.literal: Three. Attacked Zhao. Wei Ping Hou first year.
cells.idiomatic: Three. Attacked Zhao. Wei Ping Hou first year. (translated).

cells.literal: Han Xuan Hui Wang first year
cells.idiomatic: Han Xuan Hui Wang first year (translated).

cells.content: 十八。齊、魏伐我，我決河水浸之。
cells.literal: Eighteen. Qi, Wei attacked us, we released river water to flood them.
cells.idiomatic: Eighteen. Qi, Wei attacked us, we released river water to flood them. (translated).

cells.literal: Yan Yi Wang first year
Eleven. Attacked Zhao with Wei.

cells.content: 七。義渠內亂，庶長操將兵定之。
cells.literal: Seven. Yi Qu internal disorder, Shu Zhang Cao led troops pacified it.
cells.idiomatic: Seven. Yi Qu internal disorder, Shu Zhang Cao led troops pacified it. (translated).

cells.literal: Eight. Wei entered He Xi land to Qin.
cells.idiomatic: Eight. Wei entered He Xi land to Qin. (translated).

cells.content: 五。與秦河西地少梁。秦圍我焦、曲沃。
cells.literal: Five. Gave Qin He Xi land Shao Liang. Qin besieged our Jiao, Qu Wo.
cells.idiomatic: Five. Gave Qin He Xi land Shao Liang. Qin besieged our Jiao, Qu Wo. (translated).

cells.content: 九。度河，取汾陰、皮氏。圍焦，降之。與魏會應。
cells.literal: Nine. Crossed river, took Fen Yin, Pi Shi. Besieged Jiao, surrendered it. Met with Wei at Ying.
cells.idiomatic: Nine. Crossed river, took Fen Yin, Pi Shi. Besieged Jiao, surrendered it. Met with Wei at Ying. (translated).

cells.content: 六。與秦會應。秦取汾陰、皮氏。
cells.literal: Six. Met with Qin at Ying. Qin took Fen Yin, Pi Shi.
cells.idiomatic: Six. Met with Qin at Ying. Qin took Fen Yin, Pi Shi. (translated).

cells.literal: Eleven. Wei defeated us at Xing Shan.
cells.idiomatic: Eleven. Wei defeated us at Xing Shan. (translated).

cells.content: 十。張儀相。公子桑圍蒲陽，降之。魏納上郡。
cells.literal: Ten. Zhang Yi chancellor. Gong Zi Sang besieged Pu Yang, surrendered it. Wei gave Shang Jun.
cells.idiomatic: Ten. Zhang Yi chancellor. Gong Zi Sang besieged Pu Yang, surrendered it. Wei gave Shang Jun. (translated).

cells.literal: Seven. Entered Shang Jun to Qin.
cells.idiomatic: Seven. Entered Shang Jun to Qin. (translated).

cells.literal: Chu Huai Wang Huai first year
cells.idiomatic: Chu Huai Wang Huai first year (translated).

cells.literal: Fifteen. Song Jun Yan first year.
cells.idiomatic: Fifteen. Song Jun Yan first year. (translated).

cells.content: 十一。義渠君為臣。歸魏焦、曲沃。
cells.literal: Eleven. Yi Qu jun became subject. Returned Wei Jiao, Qu Wo.
cells.idiomatic: Eleven. Yi Qu jun became subject. Returned Wei Jiao, Qu Wo. (translated).

cells.literal: Eight. Qin returned our Jiao, Qu Wo.
cells.idiomatic: Eight. Qin returned our Jiao, Qu Wo. (translated).

cells.literal: Twelve. First La. Met at Long Men.
cells.idiomatic: Twelve. First La. Met at Long Men. (translated).

cells.literal: Thirteen. Fourth month Wu Wu, lord became king.
cells.idiomatic: Thirteen. Fourth month Wu Wu, lord became king. (translated).

cells.literal: Eight. Wei defeated us at Han Ju.
cells.idiomatic: Eight. Wei defeated us at Han Ju. (translated).

cells.content: 趙武靈王元年。魏敗我趙護。
cells.literal: Zhao Wu Ling Wang first year. Wei defeated us at Zhao Hu.
cells.idiomatic: Zhao Wu Ling Wang first year. Wei defeated us at Zhao Hu. (translated).

cells.content: 相張儀將兵取陝。初更元年
cells.literal: Chancellor Zhang Yi led troops took Shan. First changed first year
cells.idiomatic: Chancellor Zhang Yi led troops took Shan. First changed first year (translated).

cells.literal: Eleven. Wei Si Jun first year.
cells.idiomatic: Eleven. Wei Si Jun first year. (translated).

cells.literal: Two. Built Hang city.

cells.content: 二。相張儀與齊、楚會齧桑。
cells.literal: Two. Chancellor Zhang Yi met with Qi, Chu at Nie Sang.
cells.idiomatic: Two. Chancellor Zhang Yi met with Qi, Chu at Nie Sang. (translated).

cells.literal: Ten. Lord became king.
Six. Defeated Wei at Xiang Ling.
cells.idiomatic: Six. Defeated Wei at Xiang Ling. (translated).

cells.literal: Ten. Lord became king.
Qi Min Wang Di first year
cells.idiomatic: Qi Min Wang Di first year (translated).

cells.literal: Three. Zhang Yi dismissed chancellor, chancellor Wei.
cells.idiomatic: Three. Zhang Yi dismissed chancellor, chancellor Wei. (translated).

cells.content: 十三。秦取曲沃。平周女化為丈夫。
cells.literal: Thirteen. Qin took Qu Wo. Ping Zhou woman transformed into man.
cells.idiomatic: Thirteen. Qin took Qu Wo. Ping Zhou woman transformed into man. (translated).

cells.literal: Four. Met with Han at Ou Shu.
cells.idiomatic: Four. Met with Han at Ou Shu. (translated).

cells.literal: Five. Took Han woman as lady.
cells.idiomatic: Five. Took Han woman as lady. (translated).

cells.literal: Three. Enfeoffed Tian Ying at Xue.
cells.idiomatic: Three. Enfeoffed Tian Ying at Xue. (translated).

cells.literal: Shen Jing Wang first year.
Five. King traveled north to Rong land, reached river.
cells.idiomatic: Five. King traveled north to Rong land, reached river. (translated).

cells.literal: Yan Wang Kuai first year
Four. Welcomed woman from Qin.
Fourteen. Qin came struck us, took Yan.
cells.idiomatic: Fourteen. Qin came struck us, took Yan. (translated).

cells.literal: Ten. Built Guang Ling city.

cells.content: 七。五國共擊秦，不勝而還。
cells.literal: Seven. Five states together struck Qin, not victorious then returned.
cells.idiomatic: Seven. Five states together struck Qin, not victorious then returned. (translated).

cells.literal: Wei Ai Wang first year. Struck Qin not victorious.
cells.idiomatic: Wei Ai Wang first year. Struck Qin not victorious. (translated).

cells.literal: Fifteen. Struck Qin not victorious.
Eight. Struck Qin not victorious.
Eleven. Struck Qin not victorious.
Three. Struck Qin not victorious.
Six. Song self-established as king.

cells.content: 八。與韓、趙戰，斬首八萬。張儀復相。
cells.literal: Eight. Fought with Han, Zhao, beheaded eighty thousand. Zhang Yi again chancellor.
cells.idiomatic: Eight. Fought with Han, Zhao, beheaded eighty thousand. Zhang Yi again chancellor. (translated).

cells.literal: Two. Qi defeated us at Guan Ze.
cells.idiomatic: Two. Qi defeated us at Guan Ze. (translated).

cells.content: 十六。秦敗我脩魚，得將軍申差。
cells.literal: Sixteen. Qin defeated us at Xiu Yu, got general Shen Chai.
cells.idiomatic: Sixteen. Qin defeated us at Xiu Yu, got general Shen Chai. (translated).

cells.content: 九。與韓、魏擊秦。齊敗我觀澤。
cells.literal: Nine. Struck Qin with Han, Wei. Qi defeated us at Guan Ze.
cells.idiomatic: Nine. Struck Qin with Han, Wei. Qi defeated us at Guan Ze. (translated).

cells.literal: Nine. Struck Qin not victorious.
Twelve. Struck Qin not victorious.
Four. Struck Qin not victorious.
Seven. Song defeated us at Xing Qu.
cells.idiomatic: Seven. Song defeated us at Xing Qu. (translated).

cells.content: 九。擊蜀，滅之。取趙中都、西陽。
cells.literal: Nine. Struck Shu, extinguished it. Took Zhao Zhong Du, Xi Yang.
cells.idiomatic: Nine. Struck Shu, extinguished it. Took Zhao Zhong Du, Xi Yang. (translated).

cells.literal: Nine. Struck Qin not victorious.
Thirteen. Struck Qin not victorious.
Five. Struck Qin not victorious.
Eight. Song defeated us at Xing Qu.
cells.idiomatic: Eight. Song defeated us at Xing Qu. (translated).

cells.content: 五。君讓其臣子之國，顧為臣。
cells.literal: Five. Lord yielded his minister Zi Zhi's state, then became minister.
cells.idiomatic: Five. Lord yielded his minister Zi Zhi's state, then became minister. (translated).

cells.literal: Ten. Struck Qin not victorious.
Fourteen. Struck Qin not victorious.
Six. Struck Qin not victorious.
Nine. Song defeated us at Xing Qu.
cells.idiomatic: Nine. Song defeated us at Xing Qu. (translated).

cells.literal: Eleven. Qin defeated our general Ying.
cells.idiomatic: Eleven. Qin defeated our general Ying. (translated).

cells.literal: Eleven. Struck Qin not victorious.
Fifteen. Struck Qin not victorious.
Seven. Struck Qin not victorious.
Ten. Song defeated us at Xing Qu.
cells.idiomatic: Ten. Song defeated us at Xing Qu. (translated).

cells.literal: Zhou Nan Wang first year..

cells.content: 十一。侵義渠，得二十五城。
cells.literal: Eleven. Invaded Yi Qu, got twenty-five cities.
cells.idiomatic: Eleven. Invaded Yi Qu, got twenty-five cities. (translated).

cells.content: 五。秦拔我曲沃，歸其人。走犀首岸門。
cells.literal: Five. Qin pulled our Qu Wo, returned its people. Xi Shou fled to An Men.
cells.idiomatic: Five. Qin pulled our Qu Wo, returned its people. Xi Shou fled to An Men. (translated).

cells.literal: Sixteen. Struck Qin not victorious.
Eight. Struck Qin not victorious.
Eleven. Song defeated us at Xing Qu.
cells.idiomatic: Eleven. Song defeated us at Xing Qu. (translated).

cells.content: 七。君噲及太子相子之皆死。
cells.literal: Seven. Lord Kuai and crown prince Xiang Zi both died.
cells.idiomatic: Seven. Lord Kuai and crown prince Xiang Zi both died. (translated).

cells.literal: Thirteen. Struck Qin not victorious.
Seventeen. Struck Qin not victorious.

cells.content: 十二。樗里子擊藺陽，虜趙將。公子繇通封蜀。
cells.literal: Twelve. Chu Li Zi struck Lin Yang, captured Zhao general. Gong Zi You through enfeoffment Shu.
cells.idiomatic: Twelve. Chu Li Zi struck Lin Yang, captured Zhao general. Gong Zi You through enfeoffment Shu. (translated).

cells.content: 六。秦來立公子政為太子。與秦王會臨晉。
cells.literal: Twelve. Song defeated us at Xing Qu.
cells.idiomatic: Twelve. Song defeated us at Xing Qu. (translated).

cells.content: 十三。秦拔我藺，虜將趙莊。
cells.literal: Thirteen. Qin pulled our Lin, captured general Zhao Zhuang.
cells.idiomatic: Thirteen. Qin pulled our Lin, captured general Zhao Zhuang. (translated).

cells.literal: Fourteen. Struck Qin not victorious.
Eighteen. Struck Qin not victorious.
Ten. Struck Qin not victorious.
Thirteen. Song defeated us at Xing Qu.
cells.idiomatic: Thirteen. Song defeated us at Xing Qu. (translated).

cells.content: 十三。庶長章擊楚，斬首八萬。
cells.literal: Thirteen. Shu Zhang Zhang struck Chu, beheaded eighty thousand.
cells.idiomatic: Thirteen. Shu Zhang Zhang struck Chu, beheaded eighty thousand. (translated).

cells.content: 七。擊齊，虜聲子於濮。與秦擊燕。

Thirty. Qin took our Gao Du, Ji.
cells.idiomatic: Thirty. Qin took our Gao Du, Ji. (translated).

cells.content: 楚王負芻元年。負芻，哀王庶兄。
cells.literal: Chu Wang Fu Chu first year. Fu Chu, Ai Wang concubine brother.
cells.idiomatic: Chu Wang Fu Chu first year. Fu Chu, Ai Wang concubine brother. (translated).

cells.content: 二十八。太子丹使荊軻刺秦王，秦伐我。
cells.literal: Twenty-eight. Crown prince Dan sent Jing Ke to assassinate Qin Wang, Qin attacked us.
cells.idiomatic: Twenty-eight. Crown prince Dan sent Jing Ke to assassinate Qin Wang, Qin attacked us. (translated).

cells.literal: Twenty-one. Wang Ben struck Chu.
Two. Qin greatly broke us, took ten cities.
cells.idiomatic: Two. Qin greatly broke us, took ten cities. (translated).

cells.content: 二十九。秦拔我薊，得太子丹。王徙遼東。
cells.literal: Twenty-nine. Qin pulled our Ji, got crown prince Dan. Wang moved to Liao Dong.
cells.idiomatic: Twenty-nine. Qin pulled our Ji, got crown prince Dan. Wang moved to Liao Dong. (translated).

cells.literal: Twenty-three. Wang Jian attacked Wei, took Wu Cheng.
cells.idiomatic: Twenty-three. Wang Jian attacked Wei, took Wu Cheng. (translated).

cells.content: 二十二。王賁擊魏，得其王假，盡取其地。
cells.literal: Twenty-two. Wang Ben struck Wei, got their Wang Jia, took all their land.
cells.idiomatic: Twenty-two. Wang Ben struck Wei, got their Wang Jia, took all their land. (translated).

cells.literal: Three. Qin captured Wang Jia.
Thirty-two. Qin took our Wu Cheng.
cells.idiomatic: Thirty-two. Qin took our Wu Cheng. (translated).

cells.content: 二十三。王翦、蒙武擊破楚軍，殺其將項燕。
cells.literal: Twenty-three. Wang Jian, Meng Wu struck broke Chu army, killed their general Xiang Yan.
cells.idiomatic: Twenty-three. Wang Jian, Meng Wu struck broke Chu army, killed their general Xiang Yan. (translated).

cells.literal: Four. Qin broke our general Xiang Yan.
cells.idiomatic: Four. Qin broke our general Xiang Yan. (translated).

cells.literal: Twenty-five. Wang Jian attacked Chu, took Yan Ying.
cells.idiomatic: Twenty-five. Wang Jian attacked Chu, took Yan Ying. (translated).

cells.content: 二十四。王翦、蒙武破楚，虜其王負芻。
cells.literal: Twenty-four. Wang Jian, Meng Wu broke Chu, captured their Wang Fu Chu.
cells.idiomatic: Twenty-four. Wang Jian, Meng Wu broke Chu, captured their Wang Fu Chu. (translated).

cells.literal: Five. Qin captured Wang Fu Chu. Qin extinguished Chu.
cells.idiomatic: Five. Qin captured Wang Fu Chu. Qin extinguished Chu. (translated).

cells.content: 二十五。王賁擊燕，虜王喜。又擊得代王嘉。五月，天下大酺。
cells.literal: Twenty-five. Wang Ben struck Yan, captured Wang Xi. Again struck got Dai Wang Jia. Fifth month, all under heaven greatly feasted.
cells.idiomatic: Twenty-five. Wang Ben struck Yan, captured Wang Xi. Again struck got Dai Wang Jia. Fifth month, all under heaven greatly feasted. (translated).

cells.content: 六。秦將王賁虜王嘉，秦滅趙。
cells.literal: Six. Qin general Wang Ben captured Wang Jia, Qin extinguished Zhao.
cells.idiomatic: Six. Qin general Wang Ben captured Wang Jia, Qin extinguished Zhao. (translated).

cells.content: 三十三。秦虜王喜，拔遼東，秦滅燕。
cells.literal: Thirty-three. Qin captured Wang Xi, pulled Liao Dong, Qin extinguished Yan.
cells.idiomatic: Thirty-three. Qin captured Wang Xi, pulled Liao Dong, Qin extinguished Yan. (translated).

cells.content: 二十六。王賁擊齊，虜王建。初并天下，立為皇帝。
cells.literal: Twenty-six. Wang Ben struck Qi, captured Wang Jian. First united all under heaven, established as emperor.
cells.idiomatic: Twenty-six. Wang Ben struck Qi, captured Wang Jian. First united all under heaven, established as emperor. (translated).

cells.content: 四十四。秦虜王建。秦滅齊。
cells.literal: Forty-four. Qin captured Wang Jian. Qin extinguished Qi.
cells.idiomatic: Forty-four. Qin captured Wang Jian. Qin extinguished Qi. (translated).

cells.content: 二十七更命河為「德水」。為金人十二。命民曰「黔首」。同天下書。分為三十六郡。
cells.literal: Twenty-seven changed named He river 'De Water'. Made twelve gold men. Commanded people called 'Qian Shou'. Unified all under heaven writing. Divided into thirty-six jun.
cells.idiomatic: Twenty-seven changed named He river 'De Water'. Made twelve gold men. Commanded people called 'Qian Shou'. Unified all under heaven writing. Divided into thirty-six jun. (translated).

cells.content: 二十八為阿房宮。之衡山。治馳道。帝之琅邪，道南郡入。為太極廟。賜戶三十，爵一級。
cells.literal: Twenty-eight made E Pang Palace. Went to Heng Shan. Repaired chariot roads. Emperor went to Lang Ya, passed Nan Jun entered. Made Tai Ji temple. Granted households thirty, rank one level.
cells.idiomatic: Twenty-eight made E Pang Palace. Went to Heng Shan. Repaired chariot roads. Emperor went to Lang Ya, passed Nan Jun entered. Made Tai Ji temple. Granted households thirty, rank one level. (translated).

cells.content: 二十九郡縣大索十日。帝之琅邪，道上黨入。
cells.literal: Twenty-nine jun xian great search ten days. Emperor went to Lang Ya, passed Shang Dang entered.
cells.idiomatic: Twenty-nine jun xian great search ten days. Emperor went to Lang Ya, passed Shang Dang entered. (translated).

cells.content: 三十一更命臘曰「嘉平」。賜黔首里六石米二羊，以嘉平。大索二十日。
cells.literal: Thirty-one changed named La 'Jia Ping'. Granted Qian Shou li six dan rice two sheep, with Jia Ping. Great search twenty days.
cells.idiomatic: Thirty-one changed named La 'Jia Ping'. Granted Qian Shou li six dan rice two sheep, with Jia Ping. Great search twenty days. (translated).

cells.content: 三十二帝之碣石，道上郡入。
cells.literal: Thirty-two emperor went to Jie Shi, passed Shang Jun entered.
cells.idiomatic: Thirty-two emperor went to Jie Shi, passed Shang Jun entered. (translated).

cells.content: 三十三遣諸逋亡及賈人贅婿略取陸梁，為桂林、南海、象郡，以適戍。西北取戎為三十四縣。築長城河上，蒙恬將三十萬。
cells.literal: Thirty-three sent various fugitives and merchants concubine sons to plunder take Lu Liang, made Gui Lin, Nan Hai, Xiang jun, for garrisoning. Northwest took Rong made thirty-four xian. Built long wall He river, Meng Tian led thirty thousand.
cells.idiomatic: Thirty-three sent various fugitives and merchants concubine sons to plunder take Lu Liang, made Gui Lin, Nan Hai, Xiang jun, for garrisoning. Northwest took Rong made thirty-four xian. Built long wall He river, Meng Tian led thirty thousand. (translated).

cells.content: 三十四適治獄不直者築長城。取南方越地。覆獄故失。
cells.literal: Thirty-four sent handled prison unjust ones built long wall. Took southern Yue land. Reversed prison old losses.
cells.idiomatic: Thirty-four sent handled prison unjust ones built long wall. Took southern Yue land. Reversed prison old losses. (translated).

cells.content: 三十五為直道，道九原，通甘泉。
cells.literal: Thirty-five made straight road, road Jiu Yuan, connected Gan Quan.
cells.idiomatic: Thirty-five made straight road, road Jiu Yuan, connected Gan Quan. (translated).

cells.content: 三十六徙民於北河、榆中，耐徙三處，拜爵一級。石畫下東郡，有文言「地分。」
cells.literal: Thirty-six moved people to Bei He, Yu Zhong, endured moved three places, bestowed rank one level. Stone carved under Dong Jun, had writing 'Land divided.'
cells.idiomatic: Thirty-six moved people to Bei He, Yu Zhong, endured moved three places, bestowed rank one level. Stone carved under Dong Jun, had writing 'Land divided.' (translated).

cells.content: 三十七十月，帝之會稽、琅邪，還至沙丘崩。子胡亥立，為二世皇帝。殺蒙恬。道九原入。復行錢。
cells.literal: Thirty-seven tenth month, emperor went to Hui Ji, Lang Ya, returned to Sha Qiu collapsed. Son Hu Hai established, became Er Shi emperor. Killed Meng Tian. Road Jiu Yuan entered. Again circulated coin.
cells.idiomatic: Thirty-seven tenth month, emperor went to Hui Ji, Lang Ya, returned to Sha Qiu collapsed. Son Hu Hai established, became Er Shi emperor. Killed Meng Tian. Road Jiu Yuan entered. Again circulated coin. (translated).

cells.content: 二世元年十月戊寅，大赦罪人。十一月，為兔園。十二月，就阿房宮。其九月，郡縣皆反。楚兵至戲，章邯擊卻之。出衛君角為庶人。
cells.literal: Er Shi first year tenth month Wu Yin, great amnesty criminals. Eleventh month, made Tu Yuan. Twelfth month, entered E Pang Palace. That ninth month, jun xian all rebelled. Chu troops reached Xi, Zhang Han struck repelled them. Sent out Wei Jun Jiao as commoner.
cells.idiomatic: Er Shi first year tenth month Wu Yin, great amnesty criminals. Eleventh month, made Tu Yuan. Twelfth month, entered E Pang Palace. That ninth month, jun xian all rebelled. Chu troops reached Xi, Zhang Han struck repelled them. Sent out Wei Jun Jiao as commoner. (translated).

cells.content: 二將軍章邯、長史司馬欣、都尉董翳追楚兵至河。誅丞相斯、去疾，將軍馮劫。
cells.literal: Two generals Zhang Han, Chang Shi Si Ma Xin, Du Wei Dong Yi pursued Chu troops to river. Executed chancellor Si, Qu Ji, general Feng Jie.
cells.idiomatic: Two generals Zhang Han, Chang Shi Si Ma Xin, Du Wei Dong Yi pursued Chu troops to river. Executed chancellor Si, Qu Ji, general Feng Jie. (translated).

cells.content: 三趙高反，二世自殺，高立二世兄子嬰。子嬰立，剌殺高，夷三族。諸侯入秦，嬰降，為項羽所殺。尋誅羽，天下屬漢。
cells.literal: Three Zhao Gao rebelled, Er Shi suicide, Gao established Er Shi younger brother Zi Ying. Zi Ying established, assassinated Gao, exterminated three clans. Feudal lords entered Qin, Ying surrendered, killed by Xiang Yu. Soon executed Yu, all under heaven belonged to Han.
cells.idiomatic: Three Zhao Gao rebelled, Er Shi suicide, Gao established Er Shi younger brother Zi Ying. Zi Ying established, assassinated Gao, exterminated three clans. Feudal lords entered Qin, Ying surrendered, killed by Xiang Yu. Soon executed Yu, all under heaven belonged to Han. (translated).
